rsbNotes.title: Ps 40
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 40 This psalm has two sections joined together with vv. 9–10 as an appropriate transition. God has answered an earlier prayer of the psalmist, but he still has problems to bring before God. He looks to God in a time of new crisis.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 40:12
rsbNotes.text: 40:12 evils . . . iniquities. The psalmist identifies the source of his troubles as both external (enemies seeking to thwart him) and internal (his own sin).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 40:13–17
rsbNotes.text: 40:13–17 See notes Ps. 70.
